proposals.reasoning: This lines up with my earlier preference for Bob + Diana: we get an early read on one of the vocal players (Bob) without immediately giving the most visible early leaders double cover, and we include Diana as the generally agreed-on info-gathering pick. I’ll stay off this first mission so it remains low-stakes and doesn’t overload the team with people who’ve been steering the discussion.

votes.comment: First mission is low-risk, and this team avoids the one known evil to me while giving us early info on Bob and Diana.
As good Percival, I’m comfortable going, and pairing with Diana matches the table’s info-gathering plan without giving too much cover to any early leader.
This matches my earlier preference for pairing one vocal player (Bob) with Diana for an info-gathering first mission.
I know I’m good; using a 2-person first mission with one vocal player (Bob) is a reasonable info-gathering start, and a single early fail is still recoverable.
This matches my earlier stated preference for Bob + Diana as a low-stakes info-gathering first mission, so I’m fine sending it.
Early info mission and most people are comfortable with Bob + Diana; odds aren’t great but rejecting repeatedly gives us even less to work with.

discussion.content: For a first mission with only two slots, I’d rather pick people who haven’t been pushing too hard to control the discussion yet—maybe something like Bob and Diana feels reasonably safe to start gathering info. We should avoid putting anyone on just because they’re loudly volunteering this early.

I’m okay being on the first team, but I’d slightly prefer pairing with you, Alice, or with Eve so we start testing at least one of the people who’ve already spoken up. If we go with me and Diana, we should treat it as a pure info-gathering mission and not over-read a single success or fail.

For the first mission I’d actually rather see one of Alice/Bob paired with someone quieter like Diana, just so we’re not overloading the team with the most vocal people. Alice + Diana or Bob + Diana both seem like reasonable info-gathering starts.

I’m okay being on the first team, but between the options I slightly prefer Alice + Diana over Bob + Diana, just because Alice has been more consistent about treating this as info-gathering rather than steering it. If we do pick me, though, I’d like at least one of Alice/Bob so we’re testing someone who’s been driving the early discussion.

I slightly prefer Bob + Diana over Alice + Diana, just so we’re not automatically putting the early “leader” on the very first team. I’m fine staying off this one and treating it as a low-stakes info mission.

Given how quickly everyone’s converged on “Diana + someone,” I’d rather see Alice + Diana this round so we’re only testing one of the two early drivers (Alice/Bob) instead of giving both of them immediate cover.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 with Bob and Diana succeeded with 0 fails, making the pair at least relatively low-risk; while it’s still possible one of them is evil who chose not to fail early, a double-evil team there is very unlikely. Reusing that core provides our best anchor. For the third slot, everyone but me has been nudging toward Charlie, which feels a bit too unanimous and could indicate coordinated evil influence. By adding myself instead of Charlie, we get a fresh data point that doesn’t follow the crowd’s push, while still leaning on the only clean result we have so far.

votes.comment: Team excludes the only clearly suspicious player so far and reuses the successful mission 1 core, giving a relatively safe lineup and valuable info even if it fails.
I trust the Bob+Diana core from the clean first mission, and adding Frank over the heavily-pushed Charlie gives us a solid team with useful new information.
As evil I want a team that includes at least one of us; this lineup is almost certainly all good and likely to succeed.
Bob+Diana are our only clean data point so far, and adding Frank instead of the heavily-pushed Charlie gives us new info without following the crowd too closely.
I’d rather stick with the earlier consensus of Bob+Diana+Charlie; swapping in Frank now feels like overreacting to a ‘push’ on Charlie and gives us less consistent info from mission to mission.
I’m good, and reusing the clean Bob–Diana core with me instead of the heavily pushed Charlie reduces the chance of coordinated evil influence while still leaning on our best data point.

discussion.content: Given the clean first mission, Bob and Diana feel like our safest anchors right now, so I’d be happy seeing them both go again. For the third slot, I’d lean toward someone who hasn’t led yet—maybe Charlie or Frank—so we’re spreading information without handing the team back to Eve.
I like keeping me and Diana as the core since mission 1 was clean, and I’d slightly prefer adding Charlie here so we get new info without looping back to Eve’s leadership just yet.

I’m good with reusing Bob and Diana since that’s our only clean data point so far, and I don’t mind being the third if we want fresh info without cycling back to Eve right away. If people are uneasy about me, Frank as the third also seems reasonable, but I’d rather not start doubting the mission 1 pair yet.

I’m obviously biased, but reusing the Mission 1 core of Bob and me makes sense since that’s our only confirmed clean result so far, and between Charlie and Frank I slightly prefer Charlie this round so we get new info without looping leadership back to Eve yet.

I’m fine leaning on the Mission 1 result for now, so Bob and Diana staying on makes sense to me, and between Charlie and Frank I’d also rather add Charlie so we get new info without cycling back to my leadership yet.

I’m on board keeping Bob and Diana as the core since a spy pair there would almost certainly have hit mission 1, but I’m a bit wary of how unanimously Charlie’s being pushed—between Charlie and me, I’d slightly rather see myself on this team for a cleaner data point.

proposals.reasoning: We’ve had two clean missions featuring the Bob/Diana core, and the second mission added Frank with another clean result, so keeping that proven trio together is our strongest information-based choice so far. Adding me (Alice) as the fourth keeps the team mostly consistent while still introducing one new variable, which gives us useful information: if this mission succeeds, we’ll have very strong evidence that all four are likely good; if it fails, we’ll clearly know the spy must be among the new addition or the existing core, which is a much more constrained problem than reshuffling everything or bringing in someone from completely untested combinations.

votes.comment: Eve is the only confirmed evil I see and she’s not on this team; sticking with the previously clean core plus one is our best shot at a clean third mission.
Two clean missions with the Bob/Diana/Frank core; adding only Alice introduces limited new risk while giving strong info, and statistically the spies are more likely outside this proven trio.
Sticking with the exact same core after two missions is too risky—if there’s a hidden spy in Bob/Diana/Frank, this team hands them the game. We need at least one swap to properly test that bloc.
Two clean missions with the Bob/Diana core and one including Frank make this the most trustworthy group so far; adding Alice gives good info and likely secures the third success.

I still don’t like locking in the Bob/Diana/Frank core for a third straight mission—if even one of them is evil we just hand over the game, and this team doesn’t really test anything new beyond adding Alice.
Two clean missions with Bob/Diana/Frank; excluding the most vocal opponents (Charlie/Eve) is consistent with current info, so this is our safest high-info team.

discussion.content: Given we’ve had two clean missions with Bob, Diana, and Frank, I’d really like at least three of them on this next team. For the fourth spot, I’m fine with either me or Charlie, but I’d strongly prefer keeping it consistent with what’s already worked.
Sticking with the Bob/Diana/Frank core makes sense after two clean missions, and I’d lean toward adding Alice this time to keep things mostly consistent while still learning a bit more.

I’m a little wary of locking in a Bob/Diana/Frank bloc after just two missions—if there’s a hidden evil in there, we’re handing them the game. I’d like to see at least one change, maybe swap one of them out for me or Alice so we’re actually testing people instead of just assuming they’re all clear.

Given two clean missions, I’m very comfortable keeping the Bob/Diana/Frank core, and for the fourth I slightly prefer adding Alice so we learn more while still leaning on the most proven group we have.

I’m with Charlie that locking in Bob/Diana/Frank every time is risky—if we’re wrong about even one of them, we’re cooked. I’d like to see at least one swap this round, maybe bring in Charlie or me so we’re actually testing new info instead of just repeating the same team.

Given two clean missions with Bob and Diana, I’m strongly in favor of keeping that core together with me, and I’d add Alice this time so we stay mostly consistent while getting new info. If this team fails, we learn a ton; if it passes, we’re in a fantastic spot.

evil_discussion.content: I’m leaning pretty hard toward Alice as Merlin: she consistently nudges teams away from Eve’s leadership without ever outright shading her as suspicious, and she keeps framing Bob/Diana as “safest anchors” in a very soft, guiding way that feels like someone quietly herding us toward the known-goods. Bob and Diana read more like confident cleared goods riding the mission results than someone with extra info, and Frank’s wariness of me feels more like organic paranoia than informed steering.

I’m mostly with you on Alice: she keeps “soft-clearing” Bob/Diana as anchors without ever really interrogating how quickly the table locked into that pair, and she’s been very comfortable letting others do the loud pushing while she gently reframes things as if she already knows where the safety is. Bob and Diana both feel like they’re just trusting the mission results and leaning into being perceived as clean, whereas Alice’s tone is more like someone subtly shepherding consensus rather than actually solving. If we’re wrong on Alice, my backup would be Frank, but only because his “I’m wary of how unanimously Charlie’s being pushed” comment has a slight whiff of extra info about not wanting a mis-execution on a good player.

assassin_phase.reasoning: Alice consistently and gently steers teams toward the ultimately successful core of Bob/Diana (and later Frank) while avoiding hard accusations, which fits someone guiding with hidden information rather than openly solving. She repeatedly frames Bob and Diana as the “safest anchors” very early and very confidently, in a way that sounds more like quiet shepherding of consensus than a normal good player reacting to limited mission data.
